intro: Bracteantha subundulata, commonly known as the undulating bracteantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Bracteantha subundulata is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
